description: This trap will be generated, when a profile is executed.

event.Summary: Profile $v1 executed on port $v5 because of $v3 event

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmProfileEventExecution EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmProfileName s EXAMPLE EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmExecutionId u 1 EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmEventType i 1 EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmExecutionStatus i 1 EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmPort u 1 EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmProfileExecVars s EXAMPLE EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmTimerName s EXAMPLE

description: The textual string identifying the name of the profile.
variables.name: EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmProfileName

description: The value uniquely identifies the execution of a UPM profile. Switch stores history of 100 last run executions.
variables.name: EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmExecutionId

description: The type of the event that triggered the profile execution.
variables.name: EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmEventType

description: The state of the profile execution.
variables.name: EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmExecutionStatus

description: The ifIndex of the port on which the profile was run.
Is non-zero only when there is a valid port associated when
the profile was run with the event. For ex: When a timer
fires, the port may not be valid parameter
variables.name: EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmPort

description: The textual string identifying the variables that were set when executing the profile.
variables.name: EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmProfileExecVars

description: The textual string identifying the timer fired when executing the profile.
variables.name: EXTREME-UPM-MIB::upmTimerName
